required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Assess the Safety and Activity of GBR 830, Compared to Placebo, in Adults With Moderate-to-severe Atopic Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa, Double-Blind, Randomised, Placebo-controlled, Exploratory Study to Evaluate the Safety, Biological Activity and Pharmacokinetics of GBR 830 in Adults With Moderate-to-Severe Atopic Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of GBR 830 on biomarkers in atopic dermatitis to enable further studies in this indication.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as any new adverse event (AEs) or worsening of an existing condition after administration of the study drug up to and including the follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Thickness of Lesional Skin Biopsies
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, before dosing (baseline), and Day 29 and Day 71, after dosing.
primary_outcome.description: Epidermal thickness was assessed in Hematoxylin and Eosin stained sections of lesional skin biopsies on Day 1 (baseline), Day 29, and Day 71.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ratio of Active Atopic Dermatitis Messenger Ribonucleic Acid (mRNA) Expression (Normalized to Human Acidic Ribosomal Protein [hARP]) in Lesional Skin Biopsies
primary_outcome.description: Ratio of post-baseline/baseline value of messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) expression in lesional skin biopsies is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI) Clinical Scores From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: In EASI, four disease characteristics of atopic dermatitis (erythema, edema/papulation, excoriation, and lichenification) are assessed for severity on a scale of 0 (absent), 1 (mild), 2 (moderate), 3 (severe). The scores are added up for each of the four body regions (Head and neck, trunk, arms, and legs). The assigned percentages of body surface area (BSA) for each section of the body are 10% for head and neck, 20% for arms, 30% for trunk, and 40% for legs, respectively. Each subtotal score is multiplied by the BSA represented by that region. In addition, an area score of 0 to 6 is assigned for each body region, depending on the percentage of AD-affected skin in that area: 0 (none), 1 (1% to 9%), 2 (10% to 29%), 3 (30% to 49%), 4 (50% to 69%), 5 (70% to 89%), or 6 (90% to 100%). Each of the body area scores are multiplied by the area affected. The resulting EASI score ranges from 0 to 72 points, with the highest score indicating worse severity of AD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) Clinical Score of 0 or 1
secondary_outcome.description: The IGA is an assessment scale used in clinical studies to determine severity of AD based on a 5-point scale ranging from 0 (clear) to 4 (severe/very severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of GBR 830 in Terms of Cmax After First and Second Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected on Day 1 and Day 29: pre-dose (15 mins), end of infusion (1 hour) and 1.5, 2, 72, and 504 hours post start of infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetics in terms of Cmax (maximum observed concentration after second [last] dosing interval) was estimated after the first and second dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of GBR 830 in Terms of AUC0-tau After the First and Second Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected on Day 1 and Day 29: pre-dose (15 mins), end of infusion (1 hour) and 1.5, 2, 72, and 504 hours post start of infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetics in terms of AUC0-tau [Trapezoid calculation of area under the serum drug concentration-time curve from time zero (pre dose time point of the infusion) to the end of the dosing interval] was estimated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Positive or Negative for Anti-drug Antibodies (ADA) to GBR 830 to Evaluate Immunogenicity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected for immunogenicity analysis at Baseline (pre-dose), and at Day 15, Day 29 (pre-dose), Day 57, and Day 85.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected at time points to detect anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) to GBR 830, as per procedures similar to collection of PK samples. Antibodies of GBR 830 were detected and confirmed using a validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) method.

arm_group.description: Two doses of GBR 830, 10 mg/kg (solution for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) four weeks apart.
Two doses of placebo (formulation buffer for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered IV four weeks apart.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, 18 years or older
- Atopic dermatitis involvement that of at least 10% body surface area
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with systemic corticosteroids within 4 weeks before randomization, and topical steroids, tacrolimus and/or pimecrolimus within 1 week before the randomization (except emollients, and mild steroids (class 6 or 7)
- Any cell-depleting agents including but not limited to rituximab: within 6 months prior to the baseline visit or until lymphocyte and CD 19+ lymphocyte counts return to normal, whichever is longer. Other biologics: within 5 half-lives or 8 weeks prior to the baseline visit, whichever is longer. Allergen immunotherapy within 6 months before the baseline visit.
- Patient with history of serious local infection and systemic infection Patient with history or current evidence of diseases such as tuberculosis, malignant disease, other inflammatory or autoimmune disease or HIV or Hepatitis B or C positive.

results_reference.citation: Guttman-Yassky E, Pavel AB, Zhou L, Estrada YD, Zhang N, Xu H, Peng X, Wen HC, Govas P, Gudi G, Ca V, Fang H, Salhi Y, Back J, Reddy V, Bissonnette R, Maari C, Grossman F, Wolff G. GBR 830, an anti-OX40, improves skin gene signatures and clinical scores in patients with atopic dermatitis. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2019 Aug;144(2):482-493.e7. doi: 10.1016/j.jaci.2018.11.053. Epub 2019 Feb 6.

group.title: GBR 830
group.description: Two doses of GBR 830, 10 mg/kg (solution for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) four weeks apart

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Two doses of placebo (formulation buffer for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered IV four weeks apart

baseline.population: A total of 64 eligible participants were randomized to receive either GBR 830 or corresponding placebo. Two participants assigned to GBR 830 withdrew informed consent before dosing. Therefore, a total of 62 subjects were included in the Full Analysis Set and Safety Analysis Set.

group.description: Two doses of GBR 830, 10 mg/kg (solution for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) four weeks apart

group.description: Two doses of placebo (formulation buffer for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered IV four weeks apart

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as any new adverse event (AEs) or worsening of an existing condition after administration of the study drug up to and including the follow-up visit.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set consisted of all participants who took at least 1 full or partial dose of study treatment and were used in the assessment and reporting of safety data.

group.title: GBR 830
group.description: Two doses of GBR 830, 10 mg/kg (solution for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) four weeks apart

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Two doses of placebo (formulation buffer for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered IV four weeks apart

measure.title: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
measure.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as any new adverse event (AEs) or worsening of an existing condition after administration of the study drug up to and including the follow-up visit.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set consisted of all participants who took at least 1 full or partial dose of study treatment and were used in the assessment and reporting of safety data.

class.title: TEAE leading to permanent withdrawal of study drug

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Thickness of Lesional Skin Biopsies
outcome.description: Epidermal thickness was assessed in Hematoxylin and Eosin stained sections of lesional skin biopsies on Day 1 (baseline), Day 29, and Day 71.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, before dosing (baseline), and Day 29 and Day 71, after dosing.
outcome.population: The Biological Activity Set (BAS) consisted of all FAS subjects who had at least 1 post-baseline skin biopsy (Visit 7, Visit 13), and received 2 doses of study drug. The primary analyses on biomarkers of disease activity obtained from biopsy were based on the BAS. Subjects were analyzed according to the treatment to which they were randomized.

outcome.population: The Biological Activity Set (BAS) consisted of all FAS participants who had at least 1 post-baseline skin biopsy (Visit 7, Visit 13), and received 2 doses of drug. The primary analyses on biomarkers of disease activity obtained from biopsy were based on the BAS. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment to which they were randomized.

outcome.title: Percent Change in Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI) Clinical Scores From Baseline
outcome.description: In EASI, four disease characteristics of atopic dermatitis (erythema, edema/papulation, excoriation, and lichenification) are assessed for severity on a scale of 0 (absent), 1 (mild), 2 (moderate), 3 (severe). The scores are added up for each of the four body regions (Head and neck, trunk, arms, and legs). The assigned percentages of body surface area (BSA) for each section of the body are 10% for head and neck, 20% for arms, 30% for trunk, and 40% for legs, respectively. Each subtotal score is multiplied by the BSA represented by that region. In addition, an area score of 0 to 6 is assigned for each body region, depending on the percentage of AD-affected skin in that area: 0 (none), 1 (1% to 9%), 2 (10% to 29%), 3 (30% to 49%), 4 (50% to 69%), 5 (70% to 89%), or 6 (90% to 100%). Each of the body area scores are multiplied by the area affected. The resulting EASI score ranges from 0 to 72 points, with the highest score indicating worse severity of AD.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): The FAS consisted of all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 partial or full dose of study treatment. The FAS population was used for the analysis of the efficacy data not obtained from skin biopsy. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment by which they were randomized.

measure.description: In EASI, four disease characteristics of atopic dermatitis (erythema, edema/papulation, excoriation, and lichenification) are assessed for severity on a scale of 0 (absent), 1 (mild), 2 (moderate), 3 (severe). The scores are added up for each of the four body regions (Head and neck, trunk, arms, and legs). The assigned percentages of body surface area (BSA) for each section of the body are 10% for head and neck, 20% for arms, 30% for trunk, and 40% for legs, respectively. Each subtotal score is multiplied by the BSA represented by that region. In addition, an area score of 0 to 6 is assigned for each body region, depending on the percentage of AD-affected skin in that area: 0 (none), 1 (1% to 9%), 2 (10% to 29%), 3 (30% to 49%), 4 (50% to 69%), 5 (70% to 89%), or 6 (90% to 100%). Each of the body area scores are multiplied by the area affected. The resulting EASI score ranges from 0 to 72 points, with the highest score indicating worse severity of AD.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): The FAS consisted of all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 partial or full dose of study treatment. The FAS population was used for the analysis of the efficacy data not obtained from skin biopsy. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment by which they were randomized.

class.title: Percent Change from Baseline to Visit 3 (Day 4)
Percent Change from Baseline to Visit 7 (day 29)
Percent Change from Baseline to Visit 12 (day 57)
Percent Change from Baseline to Visit 13 (day 71)

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) Clinical Score of 0 or 1
outcome.description: The IGA is an assessment scale used in clinical studies to determine severity of AD based on a 5-point scale ranging from 0 (clear) to 4 (severe/very severe).
outcome.population: N is the number of participants in the respective treatment group. Numbers and percentages calculated at each visit are based on the number of participants achieving IGA score of 0 or 1 among those evaluable participants at each visit.

measure.description: The IGA is an assessment scale used in clinical studies to determine severity of AD based on a 5-point scale ranging from 0 (clear) to 4 (severe/very severe).

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics of GBR 830 in Terms of Cmax After First and Second Dose.
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetics in terms of Cmax (maximum observed concentration after second [last] dosing interval) was estimated after the first and second dose.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected on Day 1 and Day 29: pre-dose (15 mins), end of infusion (1 hour) and 1.5, 2, 72, and 504 hours post start of infusion
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PKAS) consisted of the subset of the Safety Analysis Set population for which sufficient serum concentration data were available to facilitate derivation of at least 1 PK parameter, and the time (HH:MM) of dosing on the day of sampling was known for at least 1 of the dosing visits.

group.title: GBR 830
group.description: Two doses of GBR 830, 10 mg/kg (solution for infusion, prepared in normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) four weeks apart

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics of GBR 830 in Terms of Cmax After First and Second Dose.
measure.description: Pharmacokinetics in terms of Cmax (maximum observed concentration after second [last] dosing interval) was estimated after the first and second dose.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Positive or Negative for Anti-drug Antibodies (ADA) to GBR 830 to Evaluate Immunogenicity
outcome.description: Blood samples were collected at time points to detect anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) to GBR 830, as per procedures similar to collection of PK samples. Antibodies of GBR 830 were detected and confirmed using a validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) method.
outcome.time_frame: Samples collected for immunogenicity analysis at Baseline (pre-dose), and at Day 15, Day 29 (pre-dose), Day 57, and Day 85.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set consisted of all particpants who took at least 1 full or partial dose of study treatment and were used in the assessment and reporting of safety data.

measure.description: Blood samples were collected at time points to detect anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) to GBR 830, as per procedures similar to collection of PK samples. Antibodies of GBR 830 were detected and confirmed using a validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) method.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set consisted of all particpants who took at least 1 full or partial dose of study treatment and were used in the assessment and reporting of safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs and SAEs were collected from the time of signing the informed consent form (ICF) until the follow up for a total duration of 16 weeks.
reported_events.desc: A total of 64 eligible participants were randomized to receive either GBR 830 or corresponding placebo. Two participants assigned to GBR 830 withdrew informed consent before dosing. Therefore, a total of 62 subjects were included in the Full Analysis Set and Safety Analysis Set.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
